sentence.Network_en: He was clever, well-read and interested in the arts.

He had literary tastes, and was well read in science.
sentence.Network_cn: 他喜欢文学而且他科学知识渊博.

当我们说某人读书“读得很好”（Well-read）时，我们心中应该要有这些标准来作衡量的依据。太多时候，我们是用这样的句子来形容 …
Friends 老友记第六季第十九集... ... horrified: 惊悸的 well-read: 博览群书的博学的 incredible: 难以置信的，惊人的.

entry.def: A well-read person has read a lot of books and has learned a lot from them.

example.ex: He was clever, well-read and interested in the arts.
example.tran: 他很聪明，博览群书，并且对艺术很感兴趣。

means.word_mean: 1. well informed or deeply versed through reading;
2. highly educated; having extensive information or understanding;
